class.rdfs:comment: A structured value representing a price or price range. Typically, only the subclasses of this type are used for markup. It is recommended to use MonetaryAmount to describe independent amounts of money such as a salary, credit card limits, etc.
class.rdfs:label: PriceSpecification

schema:eligibleQuantity.rdfs:comment: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.
schema:eligibleQuantity.rdfs:label: eligibleQuantity

schema:eligibleTransactionVolume.rdfs:comment: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.
schema:eligibleTransactionVolume.rdfs:label: eligibleTransactionVolume

schema:maxPrice.rdfs:comment: The highest price if the price is a range.
schema:maxPrice.rdfs:label: maxPrice

schema:minPrice.rdfs:comment: The lowest price if the price is a range.
schema:minPrice.rdfs:label: minPrice

schema:price.rdfs:comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

  • Use the priceCurrency property (with standard formats: ISO 4217 currency format e.g. "USD"; Ticker symbol for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for Local Exchange Tradings Systems (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
  • Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
  • Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
  • Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
schema:price.rdfs:label: price

schema:priceCurrency.rdfs:comment:
The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Use standard formats: ISO 4217 currency format e.g. "USD"; Ticker symbol for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for Local Exchange Tradings Systems (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".
schema:priceCurrency.rdfs:label: priceCurrency

schema:validFrom.rdfs:comment: The date when the item becomes valid.
schema:validFrom.rdfs:label: validFrom

schema:validThrough.rdfs:comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
schema:validThrough.rdfs:label: validThrough

schema:valueAddedTaxIncluded.rdfs:comment: Specifies whether the applicable value-added tax (VAT) is included in the price specification or not.
schema:valueAddedTaxIncluded.rdfs:label: valueAddedTaxIncluded
